Choice 2: Recreate the graph shown below. It shows monthly homicides in Baltimore, with a reference added for the date of the arrest of Freddie Gray and color used to show colder months (November through April) versus warmer months (May through October). There is a smooth line added to help show seasonal and long-term trends in this data.
```{r}
#load data

library(readr)
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

hom <- read_csv("../data/homicide-data.csv")
```


```{r}
#make plot, choice 2

hom %>% 
  filter(city == "Baltimore") %>%
  mutate(reported_date = ymd(reported_date), 
         year = year(reported_date), 
         month = month(reported_date), 
         year_month = paste(year, month), 
         year_month = ym(year_month)) %>%
  group_by(year_month) %>%
  count() %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(cold = month(year_month) %in% c(11, 12, 1, 2, 3, 4)) %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_col(aes(x = year_month, y = n, fill = cold)) +
  geom_smooth(aes(x = year_month, y = n), span = .09, se = FALSE)

```
